name: TheAtlantic
text: “MasterClass’s mission, as it was originally defined, was to ‘democratize access to genius,’” @Carina_Chocano writes. “But the service actually offers something different—­although what that is, exactly, is hard to put your finger on.” https://t.co/KUqlV36ob9

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @stacyfmitchell: The outcome of the House's Big Tech probe will speak to two of the biggest questions we face: One is whether the tech giants will continue to wield outsize power. The other is whether we’re still capable of governing ourselves.

My piece in @TheAtlantic: 
https://t.co/sHhAMECsCt

name: TheAtlantic
text: August is typically the worst month of the Chernobyl fire season, and this year, public anxiety is mounting, writes @JBraxtonLittle: https://t.co/v6vxgbmVMo

name: TheAtlantic
text: The problem, @stacyfmitchell writes, is that "the machinery of government has been dysfunctional for so long that Americans forget it even exists. This is especially true when it comes to questions of how the economy is structured." https://t.co/IkDrhNaxMK

name: TheAtlantic
text: The arrest of a prodemocracy newspaper owner is the latest sign of the alarming erosion of freedoms in Hong Kong. @TMclaughlin3 writes of the authorities' doublespeak, and how trust is plummeting in the city: https://t.co/gVp4XsWRDY

name: TheAtlantic
text: In 28 years of teaching, Deloris Fowler has taught through a number of disappointing education reforms. But she's driven to show students the joy in reading—regardless of the curriculum, writes @natwexler: https://t.co/QzaDkL7gBh

name: TheAtlantic
text:
More than 300,000 people with disabilities are paid below the minimum wage because of a legal loophole—one that a Joe Biden presidency could end, @sarahbea89 writes.
https://t.co/gswyB6uXhV

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @YasmeenSerhan: The arrest of a prodemocracy newspaper owner is the latest sign of the alarming erosion of freedoms in Hong Kong. 

Read @TMclaughlin3 on the authorities' doublespeak and how trust is plummeting in the city: https://t.co/92WYTNtyyb

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @sarahzhang: ICYMI, I wrote about why the coronavirus is probably never going away and why that's not as scary as it sounds at first 

https://t.co/fkiMVDfcjj

name: TheAtlantic
text: Niubom "would have done almost anything to get back to his wife and his young daughter in St. Petersburg as quickly as possible. He just didn’t expect that would mean biking into Russia from Finland on a folding bicycle he had procured in Germany." https://t.co/26sJNmrovJ

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @YAppelbaum: 5. I’ve written about how Gettysburg was transformed into an emblem of the Lost Cause. In reality, it was a humiliating defeat for an army devoted to the defense of monstrous injustice.

That'd make it an interesting site for Trump’s acceptance speech.

https://t.co/t7qjgLAarD

name: TheAtlantic
TheAtlantic
text: A bulk carrier ship, loaded with about 4,000 tons of fuel oil, ran aground off the coast of Mauritius on July 25. Mauritius has declared a “state of environmental emergency,” as the growing spill threatens nearby reefs and lagoons. Via @TheAtlPhoto: https://t.co/jZcBomgi1k https://t.co/G7b3RNX3jj

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Commentators can ignore the way American politics actually works," @peterbeinart writes. "Black women who want a career in national politics cannot." https://t.co/0B9LOzBSpM

name: TheAtlantic
text: The pandemic could magnify Democrats’ existing advantage in mail-in voting—and that could lead to weeks of contention in November. https://t.co/HCdSKYuSYQ

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @edyong209: This incredible @themadstone piece is like Homeward Bound except instead of pets, it’s Arctic scientists, and also there’s a pandemic. 

https://t.co/pQWtrTLAOP

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @AdrienneLaF: "By sucking up the nuclear leftovers strewn across the landscape, the forests are stabilizing the contamination." Until fire season starts, that is... https://t.co/zwfUC8jv1d

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @prashantrao: The arrest of Jimmy Lai, the Hong Kong newspaper owner, today is the latest sign of China's doublespeak when it comes to the city's freedoms.

Always, always, always read @TMclaughlin3 in @TheAtlantic https://t.co/0iine0N6RT

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @themadstone: Whatever travel delays you've experienced recently, they  likely pale in comparison to the story of the Arctic scientist who spent five months at sea because of covid, finally making it back to his country on a borrowed bike.

My latest, for @TheAtlantic https://t.co/RZmq8HJ49e

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @TheAtlPhoto: A Growing Oil Spill off the Coast of Mauritius - 16 photos from this Indian Ocean island nation, where a bulk carrier ship that ran aground two weeks ago has been leaking tons of fuel oil, threatening a pristine and protected coastline. https://t.co/gL1TUJSUje https://t.co/BU8a1KIWtW

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @JamesFallows: Small restaurants, coffee shops, breweries, and other gathering places have transformed many downtowns over the past decade.

Now they being squeezed out. Two cases of how they are trying to adapt to survive. 
https://t.co/m3iyzDG868
By me

text:
